DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety effectiveness treatment sublingual ( s/l ) Flumazenil healthy volunteer reverse effect sleep/hypnotic drug . This study design collect short-term safety tolerability data . In addition , psychomotor/ cognitive behavioral effect Flumazenil assess monitor degree duration action single use Flumazenil .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Sublingual Administration Flumazenil Reverse Effect Hypnotic Drugs Healthy Adults
DOC.criteria: 1 . The subject understood voluntarily sign informed consent form prior studymandated procedure . 2 . Male female age 1865 screening . Women childbearing potential must negative pregnancy test screen visit use reliable method contraception entire study duration ( e.g . Contraceptive pill ; Intrauterine device ; Contraceptive injection ( prolongedrelease gestagen ) ; Subdermal implantation ; Vaginal ring Transdermal patch ) . 3 . Body mass index ≥ 18.5 < 32 kg/m2 . 4 . Normal sleep habit , i.e . usual selfreported total sleep time > 6 h ; usual selfreported time fall asleep < 30 min ; usual bedtime 10:30 pm 01:00 . 5 . Subject good health determine medical history , physical examination ECG . 6 . Negative use illicit drug , alcohol ( ethanol ) , stimulant . 1 . Any use medication within 1 month prior screen visit , except contraceptive pill . 2 . Any sleep associate complains . 3 . Previous exposure Benzodiazepines and/or nonBenzodiazepine hypnotic drug within 3 month prior study initiation . 4 . History Epilepsy antiepileptic drug . 5 . Excessive caffeine consumption ( ≥ 500 mg per day ) . 6 . Pregnancy breast feed . 7 . Night shift worker within 1 month prior screen visit . 8 . Clinically relevant ECG abnormality . 9 . History alcohol drug abuse within 3 year prior screen visit . 10 . Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( CBT ) start within 1 month prior screen visit . 11 . Known hypersensitivity drug class study treatment , excipients drug formulation . 12 . Treatment another investigational drug within 1 month prior screen visit . 13 . History severe head injury .
